title: subdatasets -r does not recurse
body:
Discovered while messing with #3508 , thought it is my change but seems to be generic but could be result of me messing around with submodules there (was a mix of datalad versions and some screw ups while creating subsub2) but seems to be all good from checking .gitmodules. Tarball with this sample is at http://www.onerussian.com/tmp/datalad_temp_test_subds_pathyh6f2zwi.tgz

it seems that subdatasets discovery/listing is not recursing properly:
```shell
(git-annex)hopa:~/.tmp/datalad_temp_test_subds_pathyh6f2zwi[master]git
$> datalad ls -r .
.             [annex]  master  ✗ 2019-07-03/10:46:26  ✓
sub           [annex]  master  ✗ 2019-07-03/10:46:26  ✓
sub/subsub2   [annex]  master  ✗ 2019-07-03/10:46:25  ✓

$> git status
On branch master
nothing to commit, working tree clean

$> datalad subdatasets -r    
subdataset(ok): sub (dataset)

$> datalad subdatasets -r .
subdataset(ok): sub (dataset)

$> datalad subdatasets -r sub
subdataset(ok): sub (dataset)
subdataset(ok): sub/subsub2 (dataset)
action summary:
  subdataset (ok: 2)
```
current master:
```shell
$> datalad --version
datalad 0.12.0rc4.dev153

$> cd -
~datalad/datalad-master

$> git describe
0.12.0rc4-153-g2fccc29ef
```

it is ok with 0.11.x:

```shell
$> datalad subdatasets -r                        
subdataset(ok): sub (dataset)
subdataset(ok): sub/subsub2 (dataset)
action summary:
  subdataset (ok: 2)

$> datalad --version
datalad 0.11.5.dev18
```
